data.title: Lake effect snow advisory issued for the area
data.meta_description: A lake effect snow advisory remains in effect from noon Wednesday to 6 p.m. Thursday for Herkimer and Hamilton counties, according to the state police.
data.text:
A lake effect snow advisory remains in effect from noon Wednesday to 6 p.m. Thursday for Herkimer and Hamilton counties, according to the state police.

Blowing Snow is possible and snowfall accumulations are predicted to be from 4 to 8 inches.

Bands of snow will develop this afternoon... especially across Northern Herkimer and Hamilton counties.

The bands are expected to gradually shift southward into central and southern Herkimer County and southwest Hamilton County tonight and Thursday.

Temperatures will be in the mid 20s to lower 30s today and the single digits to upper teens tonight and Thursday.

Lake effect snow showers typically align themselves in bands and will likely be intense enough to drop several inches in localized areas. Use caution when traveling.
